SRP.Q: On Premium Users, what is the spatial relationship of the data point in 1974 relative to that in 1983 in terms of vertical (above/below) and horizontal (left/right) directions?
SRP.A: On Premium Users, the data point in 1974 is {below} and to the {left} of the data point in 1983.

SRP.Q: In 1982, what is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the line representing Premium Users relative to Mobile Users?
SRP.A: In 1982, Premium Users is {below} Mobile Users in the vertical direction.

VPR.Q: What is the trend of Free Users's User Engagement Rate levels?
VPR.A: Free Users's user engagement rate levels show a {volatile rising} trend.

NC.Q: Between 1973 and 1982, which line experienced a larger change in User Engagement Rate, Premium Users or Mobile Users?
NC.A: {Mobile Users} experienced a larger change in user engagement rate.

NC.Q: In 1977, which line had the highest User Engagement Rate, Heavy Users, Mobile Users, Premium Users, or Free Users?

NC.Q: Between 1974 and 1989, which line experienced the largest change in User Engagement Rate, Free Users, Casual Users, or Heavy Users?
NC.A: {Heavy Users} experienced the largest change in user engagement rate.

VA.Q: Perform the Douglas-Peucker algorithm to simplify the line representing the Casual Users. List the x-coordinates of data points to be preserved.(5 points need to be provided)
VA.A: The x-coordinates of the data points to be preserved are: {1973, 1980, 1982, 1983, 1991}.
